org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.asyncfs.monitor

Class StreamSlowMonitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.asyncfs.monitor.StreamSlowMonitor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConfigurationObserver

    @InterfaceAudience.Private
public class StreamSlowMonitor
extends Object
implements ConfigurationObserver
    Class for monitor the wal file flush performance. Each active wal file has a StreamSlowMonitor.

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Field Detail

      • LOG

        private static final org.slf4j.Logger LOG

      • WAL_SLOW_DETECT_MIN_COUNT_KEY

        private static final String WAL_SLOW_DETECT_MIN_COUNT_KEY
        Configure for the min count for a datanode detected slow. If a datanode is detected slow times up to this count, then it will be added to the exclude datanode cache by ExcludeDatanodeManager.tryAddExcludeDN(DatanodeInfo, String) of this regionsever.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_WAL_SLOW_DETECT_MIN_COUNT

        private static final int DEFAULT_WAL_SLOW_DETECT_MIN_COUNT
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • WAL_SLOW_DETECT_DATA_TTL_KEY

        private static final String WAL_SLOW_DETECT_DATA_TTL_KEY
        Configure for the TTL of the data that a datanode detected slow.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_WAL_SLOW_DETECT_DATA_TTL

        private static final long DEFAULT_WAL_SLOW_DETECT_DATA_TTL
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DATANODE_PACKET_FLUSH_CHECK_SPEED_MIN_DATA_LENGTH_KEY

        private static final String DATANODE_PACKET_FLUSH_CHECK_SPEED_MIN_DATA_LENGTH_KEY
        Configure for the speed check of packet min length. For packets whose data length smaller than this value, check slow by processing time. While for packets whose data length larger than this value, check slow by flushing speed.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_DATANODE_PACKET_FLUSH_CHECK_SPEED_MIN_DATA_LENGTH

        private static final long DEFAULT_DATANODE_PACKET_FLUSH_CHECK_SPEED_MIN_DATA_LENGTH
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DATANODE_SLOW_PACKET_PROCESS_TIME_KEY

        public static final String DATANODE_SLOW_PACKET_PROCESS_TIME_KEY
        Configure for the slow packet process time, a duration from send to ACK. The processing time check is for packets that data length smaller than DATANODE_PACKET_FLUSH_CHECK_SPEED_MIN_DATA_LENGTH_KEY
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_DATANODE_SLOW_PACKET_PROCESS_TIME

        private static final long DEFAULT_DATANODE_SLOW_PACKET_PROCESS_TIME
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DATANODE_SLOW_PACKET_FLUSH_MIN_SPEED_KEY

        private static final String DATANODE_SLOW_PACKET_FLUSH_MIN_SPEED_KEY
        Configure for the check of large packet(which is configured by DATANODE_PACKET_FLUSH_CHECK_SPEED_MIN_DATA_LENGTH_KEY) flush speed. e.g. If the configured slow packet process time is smaller than 10s, then here 20KB/s means 64KB should be processed in less than 3.2s.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_DATANODE_SLOW_PACKET_FLUSH_MIN_SPEED

        private static final double DEFAULT_DATANODE_SLOW_PACKET_FLUSH_MIN_SPEED
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static StreamSlowMonitor create(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf,
                                       String name)

      • checkProcessTimeAndSpeed

        public void checkProcessTimeAndSpeed(org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.protocol.DatanodeInfo datanodeInfo,
                                     long packetDataLen,
                                     long processTimeMs,
                                     long lastAckTimestamp,
                                     int unfinished)
        Check if the packet process time shows that the relevant datanode is a slow node.
        Parameters:
        datanodeInfo - the datanode that processed the packet
        packetDataLen - the data length of the packet (in bytes)
        processTimeMs - the process time (in ms) of the packet on the datanode,
        lastAckTimestamp - the last acked timestamp of the packet on another datanode
        unfinished - if the packet is unfinished flushed to the datanode replicas

      • onConfigurationChange

        public void onConfigurationChange(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf)
        Description copied from interface: ConfigurationObserver
        This method would be called by the ConfigurationManager object when the Configuration object is reloaded from disk.
